intro: Hieracium aequilibratum, commonly known as the balanced hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and yellow ray florets that surround a central disk of tubular flowers. Native to Europe, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats such as meadows and roadsides. The plant produces achenes with pappus for wind dispersal, aiding in its spread. It is often considered a weed but has ecological value in supporting pollinators.
